TopicTitle: Music To Conquer Space To - Or, do you listen to music while playing?

Articles.Content:
Been curious a long time about whether I'm alone in this. Obviously the in game music is awesome, but sometimes I like a bit of something else. So I'd like to pose it to the forum: 

**What, of any, music do you play KSP, or any other game to?**

I don't mind what game it is, as long as you say which one it is. I'd like to hear what you like to hear while you play.

Here's mine:

Kraftwerk - Spacelab, Computer Love, Neon Lights (KSP)

Electric Light Orchestra - Basically anything (KSP, Minecraft)

Rush - Countdown (KSP)

(I watch a lot of YouTube in the background most of the time)
Elgar's Pomp and Circumstance Graduation March. Especially in launches.. Oh, it is epic. \*tingles\*
mine varies by my mood. I listen to Pandora a lot when i play though so i cant really give you names just some genres, such as thrash metal, dub-step,chill-step, etc. pretty much anything.
Monstercat! All of the best electronical music in one place!

These all sound pretty awesome. It'll be good when I (eventually) sit down to listen to them, this Monstercat sounds cool. Glad to see that the thread's doing its intended purpose. Also, I forgot a few;

Rejoice in the Sun - Silent Running Soundtrack. Play this one when I have a big ship just drifting aimlessly. Also, Europe Endless by Kraftwerk.

Various stuff from [OCRemix](http://ocremix.org/) (Disco Dan and McVaffe are my favorite remixers). Also Vangelis ([Mythodea](https://www.amazon.com/Mythodea-Music-NASA-Mission-Odyssey/dp/B00005OSX7/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1431317782&sr=8-1&keywords=Mythodea) is phenomenally atmostpheric).
island in space jean jacques perrey it fits strangely well

The Ambient Spacewalk soundtrack in Spotify - fits the bill perfectly!

[https://open.spotify.com/user/spotify_uk_/playlist/37iVewIaD0NRzS0Phi1hQy](https://open.spotify.com/user/spotify_uk_/playlist/37iVewIaD0NRzS0Phi1hQy)
I've started listening to SRW music while playing TF2...
